text: -Rico, nice to meet you.

I'm Rick Dodson,
head of Entertainment.

-I don't see why I had to come
all the way down here

just for him to make
this thing go away.

-You live four minutes
from here.

-That's not the point. I don't
want to establish a pattern.

-Actually, Rico, the reason
we called you down here

is because we're both new
to representing you

and we wanted you to know that
we're big fans of your work.

-Well, that's more like it.
-[ Exhales sharply ]

We got something to show you.
-Yeah? What is it?

The torture scene
in "Galaxy Quest"?

'Cause I improved
most of that scene.

-This happens to be some
of your more recent work.

-Oh, yeah?
"English Teacher"?
[ Chainsaw whirring ]

That's great.
They -- So they caught the guy.

-This is my favorite part.
-Mm.
-I don't care. That's not me.

-Are you actually going to --
-Okay, I did it. I did it.

-Yeah, we know you did it,
Chainsaw Charlie.

We're trying to figure out why.
-What do you mean why?

His stupid petunias
are on my property.

-Uhn-uhn. You lied before.
You're lying now.

I will not have a client
who lies to me.

-Why are you doing this to me?
-We're just here to help.

-And we can't do that if you
don't tell us the goddamn truth!

-I don't want him
on my team anymore.

-Well, moron, you should have
thought about that

before you --
-Stuart, that is enough!

He won't say another word
if you just tell us the truth.
-Alright.
It wasn't about the petunias.

That TikToker
made me look like a fool.

One day, I parked two inches
inside his driveway

for, like, 15 minutes to rush in
and use the facilities.

I have a sensitive colon.
-Sorry to hear that.

-When I gotta go,
the clock is ticking.

Anyway, that night I got
a call from the police

saying I needed to come down
and get a ticket

or I was going to be arrested.
-For a parking violation?

-They would never do that.
-Well, I realize that now...

but he kept me on the phone
for half an hour.

He put me through the ringer,
and it wasn't until

I got down to the police station
and I was asking for

an Officer McCracken,
that I realized --

-You were an idiot.
-It was very convincing.
Anyway, that night I got home

and there was a package
on my doorstep, and he had --

he had recorded the whole call,
so I wouldn't forget.

So I, you know,
petunia payback.

-Okay, we are gonna need
to hear that tape.

-I'd prefer you'd not.
-Jail time or your dignity.
One or the other.

-Alright, I'll get it.
I'm only four minutes away.
I'll be right back.
